tweets.text:
Hmmm where was all this public consultation and scrutiny when @EnvAgency quietly greenlighted #HS2 tunnelling through our chalk, and putting our aquifers and #chalkstreams at risk, eh?

@Feargal_Sharkey @joe_crowley https://t.co/5tjWkU91DG

@SianieRoo @EnvAgency @Cap_it_off @StinkStopthe It's very 'convenient' that #WalleysQuarryLtd  or @RedIndustries2 or whatever they are called today suddenly started turning away permit breaching loads the day the @EnvAgencyMids had a beady eye on them. What is buried there and why are we being gases?
@StinkStopthe @Cap_it_off

Personnel from JHSS have been recognised by the Standing Joint Commander for their hard work & outstanding contribution to Op INITIATE, the response to the Todbrook Reservoir incident near Whaley Bridge. Herculean effort all round. #TogetherWeDeliver https://t.co/y04YgWDh0J

It‚Äôs time for a public apology from @EnvAgencyMids surely @SimonTagg and @AaronBell4NUL . I won‚Äôt hold my breath but this is what residents have been saying for months, years and have been completely gaslit! https://t.co/GmUd1ugEvB

tweets.text: Received late data, from the @EnvAgency on HS2 tunnelling. For public water supply well bores at risk the locations are redacted so impossible to assess the danger. Why redacted "national security" is the excuse, if so important why are we putting them at risk with these tunnels.

@StinkStopthe https://t.co/cnJ8vpXsQm

@EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA This is 9pm last night, I thought it's supposed to be covered every night?

@MariaHerlihyEA @EnvAgencySE @MarkHill03 @MoretonBack1 @Jennifer_Hil1 And why have you obscured the name of the boat ??? It‚Äôs in a public place and no reason that aware of to protect its identity.

tweets.text: @sunnydayz_66 @LoneRanger77777 @BorisJohnson @PHE_uk @EnvAgency @EnvHealthNews @MattHancock @stopthestink The odourless gas worries me so much as my partner was exposed to this regularly and we didn‚Äôt know what was going on because his symptoms were so bad but no apparent reason. Was being pumped through our air vents in the office when he was working from home. Windows shut. Awful

urls.title: Water firms are main source of microplastics in UK rivers, study says
urls.description: Research says discharge of untreated sewage and wastewater during dry spells to blame

tweets.text:
They drain our chalk streams dry, dump over 3.1 million hours worth of sewage into our rivers and now this.

The water industry is the UKs' largest source of micro plastic pollution in rivers.

So much for regulation then. @Defra @Ofwat @EnvAgency 

https://t.co/Sb77dX1RmG

tweets.text: Decent message, but pollution doesn't just 'find its way into the River Lee (or Lea)', it is dumped, leeches & ends up there because of deliberate actions, poor infrastructure & a failure of regulation & investment from @EnvAgency & others. They can & must do better. https://t.co/ECywIh31Qi
